Fifa Fever - The Best of The History of Football Volume 1 and 2

It is a great ball of breathtaking. The documentary FIFA Fever: The Best of History of Soccer brings stunning images of all 17 World Cups have held so far, from the pioneer in 1930, until the consecration of Pentacampeonato Brazil in 2002.

Everything to commemorate the centenary of FIFA - Federation International de Football Association (1904/2004) - the global body that governs the Cup. Bringing Special angles and shots that were not seen on television broadcasts FIFA Fever:

The Best of The History of Football is carefully divided into chapters that are a joy for fans of the sport more popular in the world. Among them are: The great teams in history - Hungary 54, Brazil 58, Brazil 70 and Holland 74; The best players of all time, divided by position (goalkeepers, defenders, midfielders and attackers) ; The biggest controversies and errors arbitration Shows the portion of each crowd, the big games, more decisions and more heated rivalries, the most beautiful goals of the tournament, divided into categories (Long Distance Shots, pitching, Ball Stop , Played Individual and Team Played) The funniest mistakes, blunders, goals and so-called lost "that even my mother would" ...; technicians that epoch, the great "face" that turned defeat into victory seemed inevitable that unforgettable ; The greatest players of all time; fouls and fights more violent; The evolution of fashion and marketing of football.

 All this and much more in two files, videos totaling 3 hours and 15 minutes of a movie a must that every football fan should have at home.

Brazilian Portuguese audio in the voice of sports commentator and historian Orlando Duarte.

Subtitles in Portuguese, English and Spanish

Note that the narration in Portuguese is not linked to the original audio (which correspond to the subtitles). This criterion by which the narrator has chosen to make a sort of commentary on film and not a systematic narration of it. So for him to adjust opinions and viewpoints related to our nation and explain about some parts that were not originally narrated.
